pull.title: Disentangle progress estimation from checkpoints and update it
pull.body:
Fixes #9448.

This moves the transaction estimation code out of the checkpoint code and data, as this information is not used for checkpoints (a consensus-relevant property). In the last commit, the estimated transaction count is updated for mainnet and testnet to blocks from a few days ago.

rename.from: Disentangle progress estimationc from heckpoints and update it
rename.to: Disentangle progress estimation from checkpoints and update it

events.body: Just realized that this code is wrong: it assumes the SIGCHECK_VERIFICATION_FACTOR applies after the timestamp and not before (as opposed to after the last checkpoint).
Suggestion: get rid of the SIGCHECK_VERIFICATION_FACTOR entirely (as it now applies to over 80% of the chain's transactions).
I agree with getting rid of it.

events.message: [MOVEONLY] Move progress estimation out of checkpoints
Move tx estimation data out of CCheckPointData
Shorten variable names and switch to tx/s

events.body:
Concept ACK. 
I'm going to only utACK individual commits for now: a4bac66cca62a5514579a15d198f3baa80683172 3641141c8f9bdc68fcc0792ce8842a8e33ea7320

issue.title: Add updating of chainTxData to release process
issue.body:
Occasionally, the transaction count estimation data in `chainparams.cpp`'s chainTxData must be updated to reflect reality.

These constants were updated in #9472, and the total tx estimate for today is still very close. So I believe that updating once every major release is probably enough.

#9733 can be used to compute updated constants.

issue.title: [Wallet] Refactoring by using CInputCoin instead of std::pair
issue.body:
The code was using `std::pair<const CWalletTx*, unsigned int>` until now. Not only it is ugly to read, and easy to mess up, but it needlessly pass `CWalletTx` all around the code when it is not needed.

This code will simplify another PR extending `FundRawTransaction`. (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10068)

This is divided in 3 commits easy to review.

1. Just rename `std::pair<const CWalletTx*, unsigned int>` to `CInputCoin` by using a type alias
2. Transform `CInputCoin` into a class.
3. Rewrite some code which can be simplified thanks to `CInputCoin`

comments.body: I think this might not compile due to missing `,`?
Dont we use "d" for floats to disambiguate flags?
Post merge Nit: Seems  this was not fixed.
Bah, why are we using hungarian notation of variables in new code at all?

Because there is a persistent "imitate the surrounding code" suggestion. If we actually want to migrate away from using that style, I'm all for it, but it means we should start enforcing a new style in reviews.
